image.altText: A box for the ordering of candidates in South Australia's First Nations Voice to Parliament elections.

props.synopsis: Voting has closed across South Australia for the state's inaugural First Nations Voice to Parliament election, with a result not expected until the end of March.

title.children: Polls close in South Australia's inaugural First Nations Voice to Parliament election

image.altText: The Inflatable Church taped.

props.synopsis: A 20-year-old Adelaide man is charged with property damage after allegedly damaging The Inflatable Church in Adelaide's CBD.

title.children: Knife-wielding man allegedly damages premiere inflatable Adelaide Fringe show venue

image.altText: MCU of former Boeing Quality Manager John Barnett sitting in his house wearing a white open collared shirt and grey jacket

props.synopsis: Former Boeing worker John Barnett's lawyer describes the whistleblower as an "honest, open and sincere" man of integrity and said he paid "the highest price" for speaking out, in his first interview since his client's death.

title.children: At 4am in South Carolina, a Boeing whistleblower's lawyer dialled an Australian mobile number to share 'some news'

image.altText: An image of people queuing at Brisbane City Council eleciton

props.synopsis: ABC election analyst Antony Green called the vote for Adrian Schrinner shortly after 8pm, amid a swing to the Greens in some Brisbane wards.

title.children: Brisbane lord mayor returned to office after a day of delays at many Queensland council polling booths

image.altText: Kate and William at the polo

props.synopsis: While the Photoshop fail may haunt the Prince and Princess of Wales for years to come, this is not the first misstep by their office. Experts say it shows the challenges this ancient institution faces in a modern media environment, one they must meet if they hope to persist for generations to come.

title.children: 'Either stupidity or willful ignorance': What's going on in William and Kate's royal court?

image.altText: Close up of woman sorting through rack of button up shirt, representing the extra effort that ethical fashion finding requires.

props.synopsis: Markets and apps for second-hand clothes are lauded as an ethical and sustainable shopping choice. But while these markets help recycle they fail to reduce future production of waste.

title.children: Second-hand clothes can create a mountain of problems. This is why

image.altText: A St Kilda player points in the air in celebration as his teammates run back with him.

props.synopsis: A special night in Geelong awaits as the Cats face the Saints at a renovated Kardinia Park, while Gold Coast and Adelaide face off at Carrara. Follow all the action in our live blog.

title.children: Saints comeback puts them in range of the Cats at Kardinia Park

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Three quarter-time: Geelong leads by 10 points
Half-time: Gold Coast leads Adelaide by 26 points
Quarter-time: Gold Coast leads Adelaide by 13 points

image.altText: Ben Manenti wearing an Italian flag over his shoulders

props.synopsis: State cricketer Ben Manenti and brother Harry have been called up by their country — but the national team in question doesn't wear green and gold. The brothers find themselves alongside Sir Donald Bradman on the list of Australian cricketers with Italian heritage.

title.children: When state cricketer Ben Manenti got a national call-up for Italy, he 'thought it was a p***-take'

image.altText: A mising panel seen in a plane

props.synopsis: The Federal Aviation Administration said a post-landing airline inspection of the 25-year-old airplane revealed a missing panel.

title.children: US aviation authorities investigating Boeing flight from San Franciso that lost external panel

image.altText: A row of white self-service kiosks at a restaurant.

props.synopsis: Together, McDonald's mobile app, its self-serve kiosks and its digitised menus enable the company to eke out additional sales and efficiencies worth billions of dollars to the company. Yet that same technology can also bring McDonald's to its knees.

title.children: McDonald's has no plans to slow tech adoption, as it says global outage was due to third-party 'configuration change'

image.altText: Paul Alexander drinking his coffee with his caregiver Kathryn Gaines who is eating cereal

props.synopsis: Paul Alexander spent most of his life confined to a breathing machine that looks like a mini submarine. Here's how he spent his life.

title.children: This man lived in an iron lung for more than 70 years. Here's how he spent his life

image.altText: A pile of folded ballots at the base of a clear box.

props.synopsis: Vladimir Putin has towered over Russian politics for more than two decades — this is how he does it, from barring the strongest opposition leaders to stuffing the ballot boxes.

title.children: 'Everything in Russia is fraudulent': Inside Putin's 'sham' election

image.altText: Two people walking with a dog and a man running past with the sunrise in background

props.synopsis: To increase our health span, we need planned, structured and regular physical activity (or exercise). Is daily walking enough?

title.children: Is walking your only exercise? Here’s how to get the most out of it

image.altText: Latrell Mitchell runs with the ball for the SOuth Sydney Rabbitohs in an NRL game against the Brisbane Broncos.

props.synopsis: Latrell Mitchell's repeated F-bombs in a post-match interview prompt NRL boss Andrew Abdo to remind players of their responsibilities when speaking to the media.

title.children: NRL wants players to 'be authentic', but Latrell Mitchell's on-air swearing prompts reminder about 'responsibility'

image.altText: Red car accelerates at Westfield Liverpool Myer into the beauty counters

props.synopsis: Police say they were told a teenager was sitting in the red electric SUV which was on display inside a Sydney shopping centre before the car accelerated forward, smashing glass panels, and reversing into the Myer store.

title.children: Display car reverses into Myer shopfront at Sydney Westfield with 14yo boy inside, two men injured

image.altText: darren zanow with voters at a pre-polling booth

props.synopsis: The Labor heartland of Ipswich West has come into play, after Queensland Premier Steven Miles conceded he is prepared for a double-digit swing against the government.

title.children: Queensland premier prepared for swing against government in Ipswich West by-election

image.altText: A woman on a medical gurney in a plane

props.synopsis: The Kimberley was WA's busiest region for the Royal Flying Doctor Service last year, airlifting patients like Ella whose waters broke while she was travelling in a truck in the outback.

title.children: 'What are the chances?' How this young mum's holiday saw her rushed across the outback to give birth

image.altText: A person snorkeling underwater holding a camera

props.synopsis: They're not as famous as the iconic Great Barrier Reef, but vibrant and bustling coral reefs between Bundaberg and Moreton Bay, off Brisbane, are equally under threat with signs they're "starving to death".

title.children: Mass coral bleaching event stretching to waters off Brisbane alarms marine scientists

image.altText: Shane Rose wears an equestrian helmet while standing with his horse Virgil.

props.synopsis: Shane Rose is in hospital after suffering a "badly broken femur", fractured pelvis, broken ribs and a concussion in a "nasty fall" off his horse.

title.children: Three-time Olympian's Paris hopes in danger after suffering 'badly broken femur' in 'nasty fall' from horse

image.altText: Composite image of a woman smiling at camera and a police hound

props.synopsis: It took authorities more than a month to find missing woman Colleen South. That search has led to a coroner to recommend Victoria Police train dogs to detect human remains.

title.children: Coroner recommends Victoria Police train up cadaver dogs after month-long search for missing woman

image.altText: Young Hong Kong democrats from the so-called "resistance" or localists camp including Tiffany Yeun, Fergus Leung, Joshua Wong, Kinda Li, Sunny Cheung, Frankie Fung, Gwyneth Ho, Ventus Lau, Owen Chow, Eddie Chu, Sam Cheung, Prince Wong, Ng Kin Wai, Lester Shum, Henry Wong and Winnie Yu

props.synopsis: A Hong Kong court sentences 12 people to jail terms of up to almost seven years in a high-profile rioting case linked to a 2019 pro-democracy protest.

title.children: Twelve sentenced to jail for storming Hong Kong legislature in 2019

image.altText: Close up photo of Eric the dolphin swimming.

props.synopsis: Eric has become a popular regular at Port Broughton in South Australia, but there are safety concerns for the dolphin and swimmers after complaints to the local council about people getting "rough" with him.

title.children: Swimmers warned to leave friendly dolphin alone after reports of people trying to ride him

image.altText: A woman smiles with short brown hair, she wears a blue dress and colourful necklace, she sits at a wooden desk

props.synopsis: Crystal Petch looks like any other busy mother of two, but on the inside, her brain and immune system are working against her. She says being part of a regional support group for South Australians with similar life experiences makes it easier.

title.children: Working mum who suddenly experienced slurred speech finds her 'village' with regional support for MS

image.altText: Jackie and Julian Pagani are married on the beach

props.synopsis: The hotel rooms are vacant, the cafes are empty and the only road into this coastal hamlet is impassable. Tourist operators in Australia's far north are now questioning how they will survive.

title.children: This couple has spent months burning fuel and money to power a campsite no-one can visit

image.altText: Storm clouds drop heavy rain in the distance on a western Queensland property

props.synopsis: The forecast is above La Niña's average occurrence of once every four years, and if eventuated would represent the fourth La Niña in five years.

title.children: La Niña odds now sit at 80 per cent. How will it affect our weather?

image.altText: A yellow lease sign outside a row of terrace houses.

props.synopsis: Politicians are all too aware that a metaphorical poverty freight train is coming for a generation of renters, but can a collision be avoided, asks David Taylor.

title.children: A generation of renters is staring down poverty in retirement. Let's break down why

image.altText: Black and white wedding photo of murder victim Kelly Wilkinson smiling.

props.synopsis: Within weeks of telling her family how fearful she was of her estranged husband, he brutally murdered the 27-year-old mother-of-three in an unexpected attack in her own  backyard.

title.children: Kelly Wilkinson had a six-word code to use when she was in fear of her life – a message she never got to send

image.altText: A woman smiling at the camera while painting.

props.synopsis: Last Saturday police found Melbourne woman Chaithanya Madhagani's body. For those whose lives she changed, the loss is still hard to fathom.

title.children: A week on, the 'horrific' loss of Chaithanya Madhagani is still rippling through Melbourne

image.altText: Malinauskas refugees

props.synopsis: New arrivals in SA from war-torn countries will receive additional support from the state government as part of a new humanitarian package.

title.children: SA unveils additional support for new arrivals fleeing conflict

image.altText: Perth Police drug testing kit

props.synopsis: Roadside instant drug testing is under scrutiny after an Adelaide driver falsely tested positive to methamphetamine, but experts say the benefits of their use may outweigh the risks.

title.children: A false positive on a roadside drug test saw a man lose his licence. How widely are they used in Australia?

image.altText: An aerial image of a burnt-down mansion with a swimming pool and greenery around

props.synopsis: Delevingne shares several Instagram stories seeming to refer to the fire, which firefighters spent two hours putting out.

title.children: Cara Delevingne says her 'heart is broken' after house in Los Angeles is destroyed in fire

image.altText: Pattie Boyd holds up Christmas card from George Harrison

props.synopsis: The 1960s it-girl and former wife of George Harrison and Eric Clapton is opening her doors for a rare auction, with love letters and handwritten Beatles lyrics on offer.

title.children: 'Say hello to hubby!': Rare love letters from George Harrison and Pattie Boyd romance up for auction

image.altText: A photo of a Las Vegas emblazoned suitcase

props.synopsis: Dejaune Anderson, whose five-year-old boy Cairo Ammar Jordan was found in a suitcase in the woods in 2022, has been charged with murder.

title.children: Mother of US boy found in suitcase arrested after nearly two years on the run

image.altText: A man and woman stand together for a selfie in front of a display of Christmas lights in trees.

props.synopsis: A proposed subsidy for the "last-chance" cancer treatment that has put Geoff Nyssen into remission has again failed to get government support — a move specialists say is "unconscionable".

title.children: Geoff was told he wasn't likely to see last Christmas. Now he's in remission, but he fears others won't be so lucky

image.altText: A woman with curly hair and a printed top holds a stack of paperwork outside Darwin local court.

props.synopsis: The remote community of Angurugu, on Groote Eylandt, has hosted its first community court sitting since the new system was legislated last year. The government aims to roll the system out across five more remote communities before the end of the year.

title.children: In this remote courtroom, Aboriginal elders sit next to the judge
